Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Violation_Type: Inadmissibility based on association with a government engaging in human rights violations

Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, paragraph 35(1)(b), section 16, section 33
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant was a former lieutenant colonel in the Iraqi Army during Saddam Hussein's regime; held a rank within the top half of the military hierarchy
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Officer found the applicant inadmissible as a prescribed senior official
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the inadmissibility determination
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Federal Court dismissed the application for judicial review, upholding the officer's decision

Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied by Federal Court
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's claims of non-combat roles were considered but not determinative

Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Paragraph 35(1)(b), sections 16 and 33 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act

Crimes.Relief_Sought: Overturning of inadmissibility finding and approval of permanent residence

Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential harm relates to exclusion from Canada due to past government affiliation

Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Evidence reviewed through procedural fairness process including a fairness letter
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Paragraph 35(1)(b) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No major disputes over authenticity; weight given to official military rank
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failure to meet admissibility requirements for permanent residency
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Not applicable – inadmissibility based on status, not misrepresentation
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Canadian immigration law applied to foreign national seeking entry
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer assessed rank and structural position as indicative of seniority
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Lieutenant colonel rank placed applicant in top half of military hierarchy, satisfying 'senior official' definition
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration officer at Canadian Embassy, subject to Federal Court review
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: None found; process deemed fair and evidence adequate
